column4: I just applied updates to my ubuntu box and my nic quit working. i've tried restarting the machine, restarting services and ifup/ifdown. No luck. The lights on the jack won't even blink. Please help!
have you tried booting into the previous kernel?
reboot your system and after the bios screen hold down the shift key untill your booted into grub
what exactly is the problem from the update?
you running wireless?
No. Wired.
this happened from a update?

That's my guess. I got home. The Update Manager was prompting me to update. I hit Check to make sure I got all the latest. It went out to the internet and checked fine. I installed, restarted as requested and the network connection no longer worked.
you might have to see if a driver module for your network stoped working.  what info can you find when you type in:   sudo lshw?
sudo lshw    no question mard
It's a "RTL8111/8168B PCI Express Gigabit Ethernet controller"
is there a driver listed along in there with the controller?
driver=r8169 driver
so that is the driver that isn't working
Is there a way to rollback?
Is there a way to rollback that driver?
looking
it's best to know what the "update" updated
in /var/log/apt/     there's a bunch of history logs in there
cat /var/log/apt/history.log
I've found the list of packages updated today. I don't see anything network specific.
i wonder if it's the configuration or is it driver related or both
I'm going to have to call it quits for tonight. Thanks for your help. At least we've eliminated a few possibilities.
i'll eventually figure it out
